definitions.definition: an arrangement of the parts of something or a group of things; the form or shape that this arrangement produces

examples.text: The design is based on four configurations of squares.
There was a changing configuration of lights coming from the stadium.
The stars seemed to appear in a different configuration.

definitions.definition: the equipment and programs that form a computer system and the way that these are set up to run

examples.text: Performance will vary depending on your hardware and software configurations.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (denoting the relative position of celestial objects): from late Latin configuratio(n-), from Latin configurare ‘shape after a pattern’, from con- ‘together’ + figurare ‘to shape’.
